musicinpython

Scripts

ChordGenerator

Script that generates all chords and their notes.

Imports

os: Import the path functions.

sys: Import the arguments from the command-line.

copy: Import function to deepcopy objects.

json: Import json dumping.

Global variables

generators.chordgenerator.ROOTS: list

List containing all chord roots/tonics.

Functions

make_chromatic_scale(): Makes a chromatic scale.

get_all_intervals_index(): Gets an interval index from a list.

generate_chords(): Generates all chords.

dump_chords_to_json(): Dump chords to disk in .json format.

run(): Runs script.

Classes

Chord: Defines chords and their methods.

ChordNameFormatter: Has methods to format chord names.

TriadChordGenerator: generates triads.

SeventhChordGenerator: generates seventh chords.

ExtendedChordGenerator: generates extended chords.

class generators.chordgenerator.Chord(name='', intervals={})

Class defining chords and their methods.

Attributes

name: str

The name of the chord (e.g.: “Cm7”).

intervals: set

The intervals of the chord, in a set as to not have duplicates.

notes: str

The notes of the chord, separated by spaces.

Methods

order_intervals(): Return the chord’s intervals in order.

get_chord_notes(): Get the chord’s notes.

add_interval_and_tone(): Increment name and intervals.

get_root(): Get the chord’s root.

__init__(name='', intervals={})

Instantiate a chord.

Passes parameters to name and intervals attributes and declares an empty notes.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Passed to Chord.name.

  • intervals (set) – Passed to Chord.intervals.

add_interval_and_tone(interval: str, tone: str)

Increment the chord’s interval set and name.

get_chord_notes()

Get the notes of the chord, ordered by intervals.

First orders the chord’s intervals with order_intervals(), gets the root with get_root() and then makes a chromatic scale with make_chromatic_scale(). Next, iterates through the ordered intervals, getting the index of each one using get_all_intervals_index() and using said index on the chromatic scale to get the corresponding note.

get_root() → str

Get the chord’s root.

Check for an accident in the chord’s name and returns the portion corresponding to a root.

Returns:

The root (first note) of the chord.

Return type:

str

order_intervals() → list

Sort and return sorted chord intervals.

Declares a list with all intervals in order, then turns the intervals attribute into a list and sort it using the index of the previous list, finally returning it.

Variables:

all_intervals (list) – All intervals in order.

Returns:

The chord’s intervals in order.

Return type:

list

class generators.chordgenerator.ChordNameFormatter

Class that groups methods to format chord names.

Methods

format_triad_name(): Formats triad chord names.

format_seventh_chord_name(): Formats seventh chord names.

format_extended_chord_name(): Formats extended chord names.

__init__()
static format_extended_chord_name(chord: Chord)

Format extended chord names using replace().

Format the chords to either not have a slash or have parenthesis in its place, where applicable.

Parameters:

chord (Chord) – Chord to be formatted.

static format_seventh_chord_name(chord: Chord)

Format seventh chord names using replace().

Formats “(b5)” chords to have the suffix at the end of the name. Formats “sus” chords to have a slash between their suffix and a “7”.

Parameters:

chord (Chord) – Chord to be formatted.

static format_triad_name(chord: Chord)

Format triad names using replace().

Formats diminished chords to not have “mdim” suffix.

Parameters:

chord (Chord) – Chord to be formatted.

class generators.chordgenerator.ExtendedChordGenerator(root='')
__init__(root='')

Instantiates a generator.

Passes a parameter to the root to be used as base to the chords_generated, which is initialized as an empty list.

Parameters:

root (str) – Root of the chords to be generated.

generate()

Combine all previous methods and formats the chords.

Generates triad chords, “sus” chords, removes the unstandard ones, format them and get their notes.

class generators.chordgenerator.SeventhChordGenerator(root='')
__init__(root='')

Instantiates a generator.

Passes a parameter to the root to be used as base to the chords_generated, which is initialized as an empty list.

Parameters:

root (str) – Root of the chords to be generated.

generate()

Combine all previous methods and formats the chords.

Generates triad chords, “sus” chords, removes the unstandard ones, format them and get their notes.

class generators.chordgenerator.TriadChordGenerator(root='')

Class that defines a triad generator and its methods.

Attributes

chords_generated: list[Chord]

List of chords generated.

root: str

Note used as root of the chords generated.

Methods

generate_triads(): Generate all triads.

generate_sus_chords(): Generate all “sus” chords.

generate_power_chord(): Generate the power chord of the root.

remove_unstandard_triad_chords(): Remove selected triads.

generate(): Combines all methods and formats the chords.

__init__(root='')

Instantiates a generator.

Passes a parameter to the root to be used as base to the chords_generated, which is initialized as an empty list.

Parameters:

root (str) – Root of the chords to be generated.

generate()

Combine all previous methods and formats the chords.

Generates triad chords, “sus” chords, removes the unstandard ones, format them and get their notes.

generate_power_chord()

Create a power (5) chord and adds it to the list.

generate_sus_chords()

Generate all “sus” chords of the generator’s root.

Similar to generate_triads(), declares a dictionary with intervals and chord tones, then iterate through it, adding the elements to the chord in the process.

Variables:

sus_chords_dict (dict) – Contains “sus” chord information.

generate_triads()

Generate all triad chords with the generator’s root.

Declares dictionaries containing thirds and fifths (the components of a triad chord), with both intervals and chord tones, then iterate through them. At the end, instantiate an empty chord and use add_interval_and_tone() to add the elements to it, finally appending it to the chords_generated.

Variables:

  • thirds (dict) – Dictionary containing both thirds.

  • fifths (dict) – Dictionary containing all fifths.

remove_unstandard_triad_chords()

Remove unstandard triads from the list of chords generated.

Copies chords_generated so the removing doesn’t mess up the iteration that ensues. First, remove major chords that have “dim” in their names, then remove minor chords that have augmented particles in them.

generators.chordgenerator.get_all_intervals_index(interv: str) → int

Get an interval’s index from a list with all intervals.

generators.chordgenerator.make_chromatic_scale(root: str) → list

Make a chromatic scale based on a given root.

Declares two lists containing the keys that have sharps and flats in their scales, then make a scale with only that type of accident. Last, sets the root of the scale to be the root passed as argument.

Parameters:

root (str) – Root of the scale-to-be.

Variables:

  • sharp_keys (list) – Keys that have sharps in them.

  • flat_keys (list) – Keys that have flats in them.

Returns:

The made chromatic scale.

Return type:

list

ScaleGenerator

Generates all scales and their notes with interval variations.

Imports

os: Used to obtain path to .json file.

copy: Used to deepcopy objects.

json: Used to dump all the scales to .json format.

Global variables

generators.scalegenerator.BASE_SCALES: dict

Contains the natural major, minor, harmonic and melodic minor scales.

generators.scalegenerator.GREEK_MODES: dict

Contains the greek modes and their intervals.

generators.scalegenerator.DIATONIC_SCALES: dict

Contains all diatonic (7-note) scales.

generators.scalegenerator.PENTATONICS: dict

Contains both major and minor pentatonic scales.

generators.scalegenerator.ROOTS: list

Contains all notes to be used as scale roots.

Functions

make_chromatic_scale(): Generates a chromatic scale.

get_interval_index(): Gets an interval’s index from a list.

generate_all_scales(): Generates all scales using all roots.

dump_scales(): Dumps scales in .json format.

Classes

Scale: Defines scales.

ScaleGenerator: Generates scales.

class generators.scalegenerator.Scale(intervals='', name='')

Defines scales and their attributes and methods.

Attributes

intervals: str

The intervals of the scale, separated by spaces.

name: str

The name of the scale.

notes: str

The notes of the scale, separated by spaces.

Methods

get_root(): Get the root of the scale.

get_scale_notes(): Get the notes of the scale.

__init__(intervals='', name='')

Instantiate a scale object.

Passes optional arguments for intervals and name and declares an empty notes.

get_root() → str

Get the root of the scale object.

Checks for the presence of an accident and return the portion of the scale’s name corresponding to the root.

Returns:

The root of the scale.

Return type:

str

get_scale_notes()

Get the notes of the scale object.

First, gets the root of the scale and makes a chromatic scale based on it, then uses get_interval_index() to get each interval’s index from a list of all them and uses said index on the chromatic scale to get the respective note.

class generators.scalegenerator.ScaleGenerator(root: str)

Class that defines the scale generator.

Attributes

second_variations: dict

Contains the second degree variations and their name suffixes.

fourth_variations: dict

Contains the fourth degree variations and their name suffixes.

sixth_variations: dict

Contains the sixth degree variations and their name suffixes.

seventh_variations: dict

Contains the seventh degree variations and their name suffixes.

root: str

Root note used by the generator.

scales_generated: list

List of scales generated by the generator methods.

Methods

generate(): Generates scales based on a dictionary

add_variation(): Adds to scales variations from a dictionary

generate_variations(): Generates all possible scale variations

__init__(root: str)

Initialize the scale generator with an empty scale list.

add_variation(variation_dict: dict)

Add variations to existing scales.

Iterates through a copy of the existing scales, then through the dictionary of variations, checking if each variation in its natural form is in the scale’s intervals. If true, makes a deepcopy of the scale object, substitutes the old interval by the variation and add the variation’s name to the scale’s name. Finally, appends the new scale to scales_generated.

Parameters:

variation_dict (dict) – Dictionary containing variations.

generate(name_intervals: dict)

Make scales based on a dictionary with names and intervals.

Iterates through the dictionary, grabbing the keys to compose the name of the scale and the values to compose the intervals. Finally, append to scales_generated the composed scale.

Parameters:

name_intervals (dict) – The dictionary containing scale data.

generate_variations()

Use class dictionaries to generate all scale variations.

generators.scalegenerator.dump_scales(all_scales: list[generators.scalegenerator.Scale], dump_path='../data')

Dump scales generated to a .json file.

Declares a variable to put all scales in, then gets the notes of all scales and format said scales for putting in the variable. Afterwards, get the path of the dump using the os module and finally dumps the variable to a .json file.

Parameters:

  • all_scales (list[Scale]) – List containing all scales generated.

  • dump_path (str) – Directory to dump scales in.

Variables:

scale_dump – Variable to contain all formatted scales.

generators.scalegenerator.generate_all_scales() → list[generators.scalegenerator.Scale]

Generate all possible scales using constants and classes.

Instantiates a generic scale generator and an empty scale list, then iterates through ROOTS, setting the generator’s root to be the current iteration value. Then, uses generate() on module scale constants DIATONIC_SCALES and PENTATONICS, then generate_variations() to add all variations. After, extends the scale list with the scales generated so far and returns it at the end.

Returns:

All scales with variations included.

Return type:

list[Scale]

generators.scalegenerator.get_interval_index(interv: str) → int

Get the index of an interval from a list with all intervals.

generators.scalegenerator.make_chromatic_scale(root: str) → list

Make a chromatic scale with a given root.

Uses two variables containing possible keys and makes a new list of notes using naturals and only flats or sharps present in ROOTS, then sets the root of the scale as the one given.

Parameters:

root (str) – Root of the scale to be made.

Returns:

The generated chromatic scale.

Return type:

list
